results.title: Lives of their own
results.brief_description: From the Royal Doulton potteries in Burslem in England have come, during the past years, more than two thousand individual figure creations in fine china; each figure the product of creative imagination, patient craftsmanship and technical skill; each a work of art. Shows the complete ceramic process from a preliminary sketch to the finished figurine. A selection of pottery wares - characters from Dickens and Shakespear, from history and folklore - are shown.

results.title: Live via Early Bird
results.creator_credit: Communications Satellite Corporation, Bill Gibson and Matthew Gordon
results.brief_description: A record of the performance of the first trans-ocean satellite ever to maintain constant, wr-hour communication between two continents while in orbit. Includes an animated review of each phase in the development of the communications system, future possibilities and achievements since the advent of satellites. 48 nations share benefits of the inter-continental satellite system, of which “Early Bird” is the fore-runner. Narrated by Art Balinger.

results.title: Live TV
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, JoAnn Harrison, George Johnson and Annie O'Donoghue
results.brief_description: Aimed at illustrating the influence of television on impressionable young minds aged six to eleven, this video and activity guide is about four humans and one anthropomorphised television - “TV man” - on a mission to locate three missing classroom turtles that have disappeared from Jamie’s yard. As they close in on the missing pets, the four children must rationalise between the suggested solutions of TV man based on fictitious screen life and their natural instincts. Human know-how wins in the end.

results.title: Live teddy bears: the koala
results.brief_description: Illustrates the characteristics and habits of the koala, both in a sanctuary and in its native habitat and explains the adaptation of the koala to its environment.

results.title: Live forever
results.creator_credit: John Battsek, BBC, Film Council, Horsebridge Productions, Passion Pictures and John Dower
results.brief_description: Anecdotally hilarious documentary about the rise and fall of Brit-Pop in the 1990s and all it encompassed as a cultural phenomenon. This work assesses the mood of the times, or “Cool Britannia” as it was known, and the reasons why it was, for a while, great to be British; also addresses the role that Tony Blair and New Labor played, throwing off the drudgery of Thatcherism, embracing all that was new and youthful; and the band war between Oasis and Blur, played out on the pages on NME. Consisting almost entirely of interviews, the filmmakers have enhanced classic raw material with jazzy and judicious editing. From the insightful to the ridiculous, this is far from an exhaustive piece, but it provides an astute and witty snapshot of the times.

results.title: Live and let live
results.creator_credit: Cyril Randell, Technical and Scientific Films and Peter Ward
results.brief_description: Lack of proper care during the handling of cargo is the cause of frequent accidents on the docks. Safety regulations, safe equipment, and marked safe working loads help, but safe working men are the most important. Stresses teamwork, building proper stacks, and breaking them down correctly, using mechanical equipment with care and realising the risks involved around the hold where uneven footing leads to falls and foot injuries.

results.title: Live a life
results.creator_credit: Sally Hibbin, Parallax Pictures and Maxim Ford
results.brief_description: A concert for the unemployed was staged at the Rainbow with a line-up that included Tom Robinson, the Beat, Black Slate, OK Jive and Alexei Sayle. This film is a record of that concert and of the situation which prompted it. Discussions with the young unemployed are set against the rhetoric of the Thatcher regime.

results.title: Liu awaiting spring
results.creator_credit: Nadine Umback, New South Wales Film and Television Office, Over Exposed Productions and Andrew Soo
results.brief_description: Set against traditional Chinese music and imagery such as calligraphy and performance art a young gay Chinese man faces the dilemma of “coming out” to his family. His dilemma is complicated by the fact that one of their relatives has died from AIDS.

results.title: Little women
results.creator_credit: John McCrae, BBC and Paddy Russell
results.brief_description: In New England, the Civil War rages and the women left at home must struggle, many deprived of their menfolk, sticking together to survive and enjoy life regardless of the hardships. So it befell the March family, those “little women” of Louisa May Alcott’s novel which has delighted children and adults for generations. There is headstrong Jo, fiercely intent on a writing career, Meg with her love of life’s finer things, Amy’s wilful tantrums as she struggles through adolescence and the quiet Beth, calm in her world of music. Sibling rivalry, happy adventures and pure joy in living, despite the difficult times, are evident in this charming adaptation of the classic novel.

results.title: Little white lies
results.brief_description: Focused on developments in communication technology, this fast paced morality farce features modern convenience as an inexhaustible persecutor. Reb finds that when you’ve got a secret and they’ve got your number, a little white lie can sometimes do wonders - but not always.
